thread.title: WWE legendary tag team all-clear for Wrestlemania return after rejecting latest deal
thread.title_full: WWE legendary tag team all-clear for Wrestlemania return after rejecting latest deal

title: WWE legendary tag team all-clear for Wrestlemania return after rejecting latest deal
text:
WWE legendary tag team all-clear for Wrestlemania return after rejecting latest deal WWE legendary tag team all-clear for Wrestlemania return after rejecting latest deal ONE of the WWE's most successful tag teams are set to make a sensational return to the biggest show of the year after becoming free agents. / Published 28th February 2017 “Now think about what kinda negatives changes and straight f would have to go down for us to leave” Reby Skye 
Matt Hardy last left the company in 2011, and Jeff Hardy in 2009, with both having a huge amount of success with rival promotion TNA. 
But both the brothers have rejected their latest contract offer, freeing them up for a return to the WWE at Wrestlemania . 
WWE expert and insider Dave Meltzer has reported that both the brothers are now likely to appear at the biggest show of the year. 
WWE TWIST-OF-FATE: The Hardy Boys are almost certain to return to the WWE after becoming free agent Who are the 10 longest reigning WWE World Heavyweight Champions? Monday, 12th September 2016 Check out the top 10 longest reigning WWE World Heavyweight Champions ever. 1 / 10 WireImage “Stone Cold” Steve Austin — 529 days as champion 
Matt's wife and mum of his son, King Maxell, Reby Hardy, confirmed their departure from TNA on Twitter. 
She wrote: "I've said it many times: TNA was the perfect situation for our family and how grateful I was for professionalism/ open communication/ respect. 
"Now think about what kinda negatives changes and straight f*
